claim: Different assessment methods were used to grade the students on their honours performance and to decide their final honours level (Fig. 1).
title: Fig. 1.
caption: A flow chart of the pharmacy honours program showing how students are assessed (assessment weighting) and how final overall honours grades are calculated

title: Fig. 2.
caption: A histogram of the frequency of overall honours marks; a mark of 90 and above is Honours Class 1 and eligible for university medal, a mark of 85–89 is Honours Class 1, a mark of 80–84 is Honours Class 2 Division 1, and a mark of 75–79 is Honours Class 2 Division 2

claim: Correlation analysis of 4815 to 4830 resulted in an R2-value of 0.18 (Fig. 4).
title: Fig. 4.
caption: Correlation between student’s performance in semester 1 (PHAR4815; research coursework) against their performance in semester 2 (PHAR4830; research project)

claim: The average overall honours mark was 86 with a standard deviation of 3 and was normally distributed (Fig. 2).
title: Fig. 2.

claim: When the overall honours marks of the students were compared with their WAM on entry into the program, there was a weak correlation between the two (Fig. 3; correlation analysis R2 = 0.28).
